55.heading: Tails.
55.title: "Wonder Woman, the World's Most Dangerous Human!"
55.author: Harry G
55.appears_in: Peter, art ; Robert Kanigher, script. 8 p. in Wonder Woman, no. 95 (Jan. 1958).
notes: Summary: Earth launches its first weather satellite; Wonder Woman rescues Steve Trevor during a hydrogen bomb test but becomes dangerously radioactive herself; alien invaders take over the weather satellite and Wonder Woman on her way into exile defeats them with the help of a passing comet and meteor; the rays making up the comet's tail cure the radiation sickness.
Data from Gene Reed and Lou Mougin, via Grand Comic-Book Database.

59.title: Tailspin Tommy
59.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Sid drops the go-devil and the nitro-glycerin explodes in the oil well.

60.title: Tailspin Tommy
60.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
60.series: June 6, 1931) "Dream of Future Veils Present Menace!"
notes: Summary: Guarding his oil well, Sid Temple daydreams of tropical leisure while a menacing figure approaches from behind.

61.title: Tailspin Tommy
61.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: A boy tries to stow away in Tommy's airplane for the race to Tokyo.

62.title: Tailspin Tommy
62.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
62.series: Oct. 31, 1931) "It's a Long Sit from Oakland to Tokio, Skeets!"
notes: Summary: Tommy Tomkins and Skeeter Milligan get the checkered flag, Tommy flying and Skeets at the radio.

63.title: Tailspin Tommy
63.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Before setting out on their trip the racers watch the Dornier Flying Boat land near the Golden Gate.

64.title: Tailspin Tommy
64.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Skeets plays with the earth-inductor controller and gets them right on the radio beam; they pass the Farallon Islands.

65.title: Tailspin Tommy
65.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: The mysterious woman pilot claims she's not in disguise for publicity purposes.

66.title: Tailspin Tommy
66.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: The last of the airplanes to Tokyo takes off from Oakland, and the newsreel crew compares the race with the pioneers in covered wagons, and with Lindbergh's flight.

67.title: Tailspin Tommy
67.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
67.series: Nov. 11, 1931) "No Word from Tommy and Skeeter"
notes: Summary: A crowd is watching for Tommy and Skeeter's three-point high-wing mono with one motor; a tri-motor comes into sight but that's not their Cherry Blossom.

68.title: Tailspin Tommy
68.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
68.series: Nov. 16, 1931) "This May Mean a Forced Landing at Sea"
notes: Summary: Aboard the Cherry Blossom, the radio's on the fritz, an oil line's leaking, the motor's heating up, and the front glass is covered with oil so they can't see.

69.title: Tailspin Tommy
69.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
69.series: Nov. 20, 1931) "Nothing to Go On But Nerve!"
notes: Summary: Skeeter has fixed the motor, but it's still not running.

70.title: Tailspin Tommy
70.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Tommy takes the plane low, almost into the ocean, before the motor restarts, and it's on to Hawaii and its ukeleles.

71.title: Tailspin Tommy
71.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: A crowd waits near Honolulu for the leaders of the race, but Tommy Tomkins' Cherry Blossom hasn't been heard from because of a damaged radio.

72.title: Tailspin Tommy
72.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: In Hawaii, three planes finish the first leg of the transPacific race together: the Lady Q, the Four Aces, and Tommy's three-point, the Cherry Blossom.

73.title: Tailspin Tommy
73.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: In the radio room, the storm makes contact with the planes in the Oakland-Tokio race difficult.

74.title: Tailspin Tommy
74.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: The trans-Pacific air derby is still on, but mid-air refueling above the navy carrier Saratoga is difficult because of rough flying conditions. Mention of Fay Wray.

75.title: Tailspin Tommy
75.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Skeeter is knocked off the plane during mid-air refueling, and parachutes safely into the Pacific.

76.title: Tailspin Tommy
76.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Skeeter has the navy wig-wag Tommy not to land, and asks for a suit of whites and a rope ladder.

77.title: Tailspin Tommy
77.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
77.series: Dec. 19, 1931) "A Team That Can't Be Beaten!"
notes: Summary: The Oakland-Tokio air race is still on for Skeeter and Tommy, because the navy commander is loaning him a pilot to re-board the Cherry Blossom.

78.title: Tailspin Tommy
78.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
78.series: Dec. 21, 1931) "It Takes Steady Nerves for This Trick!"
notes: Summary: Skeeter Milligan is planning to re-board the Cherry Blossom from a navy plane belonging to the carrier Saratoga.

79.title: Tailspin Tommy
79.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
79.series: Dec. 22, 1931) "Skeeter's Faith in Tommy is Supreme!"
notes: Summary: From another plane, Skeeter boards the Cherry Blossom in flight, using a rope ladder.

80.title: Tailspin Tommy
80.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: With gas and oil enough to make Tokio, the Cherry Blossom gives the Saratoga an airborne salute and Tommy and Skeeter are on their way.
